alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 11:55PM EST until December 27 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from recent excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cabarrus County in Piedmont North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1151 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated continued light rain showers falling across Cabarrus County. This rain is falling on areas with ongoing minor flooding conditions along streams and creeks, and the additional rainfall will slow any falling of the stream levels through the early morning hours. Minor flooding is thus expected to continue in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kannapolis, Concord, Harrisburg, Enochville, Mt Pleasant, Charlotte Motor Speedway, Coddle Creek Reservoir and Midland. - Flooding is most likely along the Rocky River and Back Creek. Additional flooding is likely along Clarke Creek near Harrisburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
